instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans High
threads.message:
Hey,

Liquid damaged. Boots and chimes. Fans go high. ASD came up with CPU Proximity errors. 

[url]https://photos.app.goo.gl/3F2B6ZmJa40Lw0Il2[/url]

Replaced <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>. 

pin 1 - 3.2V

Diode 

pin 11 - .494
pin 12 - .496

pin 2 - .711
pin 3 - .707
pin 4 - .708
pin 5 - .707
pin 6 -  0
pin 7 - .732
pin 8 - 0
pin 9 - .734
pin 10 - .461

Thanks. Have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans High
threads.message: Let it continue on error and check if there are more failing sensors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans High
threads.message:
Hey Duke.

Sorry, here ya go. Thanks again.

[URL]https://photos.app.goo.gl/dqy0w9mRPnRYizl82[/URL]

Since camera error is included, I disconnected it and no more high fan spin. Gonna run ASD again without it.

Update - With camera disconnected, no errors thrown. Bad connector ?

Update - Connector looks clean. SMC did get hit with some liquid.

Update - Reflowed SMC, fans still roaring.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans High
threads.message: With camera connected=error, without camera=no error, I wonder what the issue could be....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans High
threads.message:
Yea yea yea...

:rolleyes: :D




Have a good one Duke!
